intro: Gurania pseudospinulosa, commonly known as the spinulose gurania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves with a distinctive spinulose texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and numerous stamens. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
